name: Crowne Plaza Padova

reviews.title: Nice hotel but beware the map
reviews.text: This is a lovely hotel - modern clean and comfortable. The restaurant serves a good breakfast and the 12 Euro all you can eat antipasti buffet in the evening is great value. Watch out for the hotel map though - the star to mark the location is in the wrong place; it's actually north of the A4 motorway and some way from the centre of Padua.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We decided not to stay in Venice proper, having previously had our fill of bridges, steps, and other backbreaking adventures. If you've ever seen tourists arriving at the St Mark's Square vaporetto stop, you have GOT to feel sorry for rhem as thery drag their wheelies up and down, then up and down again, over hundreds of steps and bridge after bridge.

reviews.text: Our plan worked out very well - this Holiday Inn in Padua (aka Padova) is just 7 months old, and feels more like a US hotel than a Italian job. Quiet rooms, great beds, digital AC, quite decent dining room, and a cooperative albeit English-challenged front desk.

reviews.title: Excellent new hotel, good food

reviews.text: This Hotel is very modern and clean. The rooms are a little small although comfortable. The bathroom is stylish and above average. We had our granddaughter with us and although the sofa bed was excellent for her we found the room to be a little crowded. It did not really matter because there is a pleasant bar to sit in and there is plenty to do and see around. The restaurant is very good and the staff friendly and helpful. Another reviewer noted that the map is wrong and that was very good advice because the traffic arrangements around there are complicated to say the least. The best way to find it is to look for the sign to Bassano and follow that of the A4 and you will then see the hotel on your left as you turn off the highway.
reviews.title: Convenient for Padua

reviews.text: Padua is a lovely city and if you go in August it is relatively quiet. You do need a car if you stay at this hotel in my opinion. Verona is just over an hour away and well worth a visit. The hotel is only a little over half an hour from Treviso airport. We saw Aida in the Roman Arena in Verona and even if you don't like Opera it is well worth the experience to see it. If you do and you have a car make sure that you park in the Arena Car Park and get there before 6.30 pm or you will have terrible trouble parking. Lake Garda is little further on and is lovely. The area is packed full of small delightful towns and villages. Citadella for example is beautiful and well worth a trip.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in Holiday Inn in Padova, Italy for five nights in May, 2007. This hotel is outside of the city and best accessible by a taxi (10 Euros each way) but definitely worth the extra taxi trip. swe were told there is a bus about 500 meters from the hotel but we did not bother. The hotel is one year old. The rooms are spacious by European standards, clean, and modern. The service is excellent. The restaurant has decent food and reasonable prices although the town of Padova has some very nice restaurants. If we go back to this part of Italy this hotel would be our top choice. It is, compared to many other properties we stayed in Italy ,by far, the best. Our room in Venice cost us over US$600 a night versus less than US$ 120 in Holiday Inn and did not offer a quarter of what Holiday Inn offered.
reviews.title: Perfect brand new hotel

reviews.text: This was a great choice for us travelling across Europe on a car. THE HOTEL HAS FREE PARKING. Now for those renting cars in Europe you know how much parking costs in major tourist cities.
reviews.title: Brand new and perfect

reviews.text: This is a brand new Holiday Inn - we got the executive sweet with a EUR 93- per night rate and the room was spectacular. It had everything you might new, everything was spotless and did I mention brand new.
reviews.title: Great hotel

description: Crowne Plaza Padova hotel with its extensive Conference Center for up to 600 persons, is ideally located just 400m from the A4 motorway exit Padova West, and can be easily reached from Venice Marco Polo airport.Crowne Plaza Padova hotel is an excellent starting point to visit cultural cities like Venice and Verona not to forget Padova itself with its famous Scrovegni Chapel.All 179 spacious hotel bedrooms and suites are fully air conditioned and equipped with high speed internet access and flat screen TV. The hotel also offers Executive rooms, all with en-suite facilities, as well as Family and Accessible rooms. The state-of-the-art Conference centre boasts 15 meeting rooms which all have natural daylight and are equipped to cater for any need with the flexibility to hold business or social events from 6 to 750 persons. Secure wireless access is offered throughout all public areas.Campiello restaurant is an outstanding place to dine with a variety of tasty dishes freshly prepared with the finest ingredients served in a relaxed atmosphere. Enjoy also the famous Crowne Plaza breakfast. Unwind in our mini gym and relax in our bar with a specialty cocktail or just your favourite drink.Shuttle bus is available from/to Padova city centre on request.Our secure car park has space for up to 400 cars.
